title: Natural Monopolies and Marginal Cost Pricing

content.question: Regulating a natural monopoly to set its output price equal to the marginal cost of production will result in economic losses because for the last unit of output produced, marginal cost is

choices.label: less than the marginal willingness to pay and less than average total cost
greater than the marginal willingness to pay and less than average total cost
equal to the marginal willingness to pay and less than average total cost
equal to the marginal willingness to pay and equal to average total cost
greater than the marginal willingness to pay and equal to average total cost

content.answer: equal to the marginal willingness to pay and less than average total cost

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
